Name: Level1
Instructions: A program is a sequence of statements. Stack a couple of 'move forward' blocks together to help me reach the goal.

Name: Level2
Instructions: A program is a sequence of statements. Stack a couple of 'move forward' blocks together to help me reach the goal.

Name: Level3
Instructions: What should I do to follow the path?

Name: Level4
Instructions: What should I do to follow the path?

Name: Level5
Instructions: Try to reach the end of this path using only two blocks.

Name: Level6
Instructions: Try to reach the end of this path using only three blocks.

Name: Level7
Instructions: Try to reach the end of this path using only two repeat blocks.

Name: Level8
Instructions: Try to reach the end of this path using only two repeat blocks.

Name: Level9
Instructions: Try to reach the end of this path using the new repeat block.

Name: Level10
Instructions: Try to reach the end of this path using only three blocks.

Name: Level11
Instructions: Reach the goal using only five blocks.

Name: Leve12
Instructions: Reach the goal using only five blocks.

Name: Level13
Instructions: I will have to turn left when I cannot go straight. Use an 'if' block to see if their is a path in another direction.

Name: Level14
Instructions: I will have to turn right when I cannot go straight. Use an 'if' block to see if their is a path in another direction.

Name: Level15
Instructions: An 'if' condition will do something only if the condition is true.  Try turning right if there is a path to the right.

Name: Level16
Instructions: An 'if' condition will do something only if the condition is true.  Try turning right if there is a path to the right.

Name: Level17
Instructions: If-else blocks will do one thing or the other.

Name: Level18
Instructions: Use the 'if-else' block to help me get out of the maze!

Name: Level1
Instructions: I'm a turtle with chalk on my belly. Stack up blocks and press "Run Program" to make me draw the shown picture.

Name: Level2
Instructions: Draw a square, making each side a different color.

Name: Level3
Instructions: Make a square using only 3 blocks.  (Remember that blocks to set color are free.)

Name: Level4
Instructions: Draw a triangle whose sides are all 100 dots and are in random colors.  You'll have to figure out how far to turn.

Name: Level5
Instructions: Draw a triangle and then a square to draw an envelope.

Name: Level6
Instructions: Can you figure out how draw this triangle and square?

Name: Level7
Instructions: See if you can draw these green glasses.

Name: Level8
Instructions: After trying out these blocks, see what happens if you make them repeat 8 times.  It should look a little different every time you run it.

Name: Level9
Instructions: Figure out what number to replace the question marks with to draw a circle.

Name: Level10
Instructions: Draw anything you want. Some ideas are a stick figure, snowflake, or spiral.  You could also try out the new "set width" block.  Have fun!

Name: Level1
Instructions: Now you have learned how to draw different shapes, can you create a program that draws the house you made with tangram pieces?

Name: Level1
Instructions: Now you have learned how to draw different shapes, can you create a program that draws the square you made with two triangles?

Name: Level1
Instructions: Now you have learned how to draw different shapes, can you create a program that draws the arrow you made with tangram pieces?

Name: Level1
Instructions: Now you have learned how to draw different shapes, can you create a program that draws the ship you made with tangram pieces?

Name: Level1
Instructions: Help me flatten the field on my farm so it's ready for planting. Move me to the pile of dirt to remove it.

Name: Level2
Instructions: Move me to the hole and fill it with two shovelfuls of dirt.

Name: Level3
Instructions: Move me to the pile of dirt and tell me how many shovelfuls to remove using as few blocks as possible.

Name: Level4
Instructions: Make me remove the 4 piles.

Name: Level5
Instructions: Make me fill in all the holes. Each hole needs 5 shovelfuls of dirt.

Name: Level6
Instructions: Make me remove all the piles of dirt, using as few blocks as possible. Check out the new option in the dropdown menu on the while block.

Name: Level7
Instructions: I don't know how many shovelfuls of dirt this hole needs. Write a program that makes me fill it until it's even.

Name: Level8
Instructions: Make me fill in the hole at the end of the field, using as few blocks as possible.

Name: Level9
Instructions: Make me remove all the piles, using as few blocks as possible.

Name: Level10
Instructions: It's nighttime, and I can't tell how large the piles are. Now I don't have all the options I used to have on the while block. Move me along the field, and if there is a pile, remove it.

Name: Level11
Instructions: It's still dark outside. Move me along the field. If there is a pile, remove it, and if there is a hole, fill it in.

Name: Level1
Instructions: Find the familiar blocks in the new categories to draw a square in your favorite color.

Name: Level2
Instructions: Use the new "draw a square" block, found in the "Functions" category, to draw a small green square.

Name: Level3
Instructions: Use the "repeat" block to draw 3 squares of size 100, each 120 degrees apart, in random colors.

Name: Level4
Instructions: Now change the code to draw 36 squares, each 10 degrees apart.

Name: Level5
Instructions: Draw squares with sides of 50, 60, 70, 80, and 90 dots.  You'll need lots of blocks.

Name: Level6
Instructions: Modify this program with the "counter" block (found in the Variables category) to draw the same series of squares with fewer blocks than on the previous level.

Name: Level7
Instructions: Replace the pale (disabled) blocks with a "count with" block (in the Loops category) and "counter" block (in the Variables category) to draw the same spiral.

Name: Level8
Instructions: Draw three snowmen 150 dots tall in different colors, 100 dots apart.  Use the new "draw a snowman" function and "jump forward" block.

Name: Level9
Instructions: Use a "count with" loop to draw a family of snowmen with heights of 110, 100, 90, 80, and 70 dots, each 60 dots apart.

Name: Level10
Instructions: Draw whatever you want.  One idea is experimenting with different types of spirals.  What happens if you change the turn amount, rather than the move amount?

Name: Level1
Instructions: Try using the blocks to help me remove all the piles and fill in all the holes on the ground.

Name: Level2
Instructions: Use the new function block called "fill 5" to help me fill in this hole.

Name: Level3
Instructions: Use the function block to make me fill in all the holes.

Name: Level4
Instructions: Define a new function that removes 7 shovelfuls. Then use it to write a program that helps me remove all the piles.

Name: Level5
Instructions: Create a new function that removes 3 shovelfuls from a pile, and use it to help me level out all the piles.

Name: Level6
Instructions: Use the new functions, "fill 8" and "remove 8", to help me level out the pile and fill in the hole.

Name: Level7
Instructions: There's a cow in my field! Write a new function that helps me avoid the cow and remove the pile.

Name: Level8
Instructions: Use the function, "avoid the cow and remove 1", to help me remove all the piles.

Name: Level9
Instructions: Use one of the new functions to help me remove all of the piles on the ground with as few blocks as possible.

Name: Level10
Instructions: Move me across the field, and use the functions to help me remove all the piles and fill all the holes.

Name: Level1
Instructions: You can now see how the "draw a square" and "draw a circle" functions are defined.  Defining a function doesn't run its blocks.  You have to pull out the "draw a square" block to actually draw a square.

Name: Level2
Instructions: Using the "draw a square" function as an example, create a "draw a triangle" function and use it.

Name: Level3
Instructions: Draw triangular fences around the cats and a square fence around the cow.  Tip: Test the program as you go along.

Name: Level4
Instructions: See if you can figure out how to use "draw a square" and "draw a triangle" (and some other blocks) to draw a house around the lion.

Name: Level5
Instructions: Now create a "draw a house" function and use it house two cats.

Name: Level6
Instructions: Using "draw a square" as an example, add an input named "length" to "draw a triangle".  Then, draw triangles in different colors around the animals.

Name: Level7
Instructions: Add a "height" input to "draw a house" and build a big house for the elephant.

Name: Level8
Instructions: Here are all of the blocks from the previous level.  Modify "draw a house" so the turtle ends up at the bottom right corner of the new house.  Use this modified function to house all the animals.

Name: Level9
Instructions: You now know how to control the turtle, use loops ("repeat" and "count from"), and write and use functions.  Congratulations on becoming a programmer!

Name: Level10
Instructions: You're now free to do whatever you want.  One idea is to try running this program with different turn amounts (higher or lower than 90).  Other ideas are to draw a star, circle, heart, or animal.
